channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-3415] 'DataSourceSerializationTestjunit.framework.AssertionFailedError' on 'extin\ClientConnectionPoolDataSource-10_1_3_1.ser' on Windows.
item.description:
See e.g. http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/Daily/jvm1.6/testing/Limited/testSummary-627523.html

w2003, vista. jvm1.6:
1) DataSourceSerializationTestjunit.framework.AssertionFailedError: extin\ClientConnectionPoolDataSource-10_1_3_1.ser
at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.DropDatabaseSetup.removeDir(DropDatabaseSetup.java:130)

at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:23)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is a newly added test, and the problems are caused by lack of resource closing.
Seems Windows is not very happy with this, but the test passes on other platforms.

I don't have easy access to a Windows machine to test on, but I have made a patch and tested it on Solaris.
My plan is to commit it and let the change be picked up by the next iteration of the daily test run.

'derby-3415-1a.diff' adds closing of the FileInputStream, which I assume is the cause for the reported error.
I will resolve the issue if the daily test run confirms that the test runs without failures.

Committed 'derby-3415-1a.diff' to trunk with revision 627734.

As far as I can see, the test now runs without failure on Windows platforms. For instance:
http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/Daily/jvm1.6/testing/Limited/testSummary-627801.html

I leave it up to the reporter to verify this, maybe after yet another test run, and close the issue if appropriate.
